incident_updates.body: All data has been completely restored and overtime and deficit hours have been recalculated.

Some parts of the issue have been fully resolved, but work is still ongoing to restore missing attendance data. 

- Attendance periods related to integrations have been restored.
- Overtime and deficit hours have been recalculated.

Our team is continuing to address the remaining impact, and we will provide further updates as progress is made.

Thank you for your patience!

We are still working on restoring all affected data and fully resolving the issue. Our team is making progress, and we will provide further updates as soon as possible.

Thank you for your patience!

We have identified the issue and are actively working on restoring affected data. 

Current progress:
- Incorrect clock-out related attendance periods have been restored
- Overtime balances are being recalculated
- Attendance data related to integrations is being restored

We will provide further updates as the recovery progresses. Thank you for your patience!

We are currently investigating an issue affecting the Time Tracking feature, which may impact tracked times and overtime balances. Our team is working to identify the root cause and and will provide updates as soon as possible.

Please be aware that the remaining system is stable and running according to expectations. Our engineering teams are already working on a solution.
 
We will keep you posted with the latest information on this page and apologize for the inconveniences.

incident_updates.body:
The issue causing the left-hand navigation bar not to load has been resolved. The fix has been successfully applied, and functionality is fully restored.

Thank you for your patience!

A fix has been implemented for the left-hand navigation bar not loading issue, and we are now monitoring the results.

We will provide further updates as needed. Thank you for your patience!

Investigating: Navigation Bar Not Loading

We are currently experiencing an issue where the left-hand navigation bar is not loading for some users. The team has identified the root cause and is actively working on a fix to mitigate the issue.

We will provide further updates as soon as possible. Thank you for your patience.

incident_updates.body: All data has been completely restored and overtime and deficit hours have been recalculated.
Attendance periods and days have now been fully restored. Overtime and deficit hours are being recalculated.

Working schedules, time trackings and the clock-in feature are now fully available again. 

We are actively working on restoring attendances tracked in the past days. 

No data has been lost and we are committed to bringing back the missing data by the start of the next business day.

We are actively investigating an incident that impacts attendances tracked in the past days, we are working on restoring that data, there is no need from your side to re add it.

Please be aware that the remaining system is stable and running according to expectations. Our engineering teams are already working on a solution.
 
We will keep you posted with the latest information on this page and apologize for the inconveniences.

incidents.name: Partial service disruption in Perfomance & Development

incident_updates.body:
We experienced an issue from 4:13 PM to 5:06 PM in the Employee Performance & Development App. Reviews and continuous feedback were not available during this time. The rest of this app was working as expected.

We apologise for any inconvenience this may have caused.

We experienced a partial performance issue between 11:26 AM and 12:10 PM (CET), which caused extended loading times and degraded performance. 

The issue got resolved and we apologise for any inconvenience this may have caused.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.

We are experiencing delays in processing, and some user data changes may not take effect for a prolonged period of time.

Please be aware that the remaining system is stable and running according to expectations. Our engineering teams are already working on a solution.
 
We will keep you posted with the latest information on this page and apologize for the inconveniences.

incident_updates.body:
Incident Summary:
Between February 12, 21:30 CET, and February 13, 09:30 CET, the Public API experienced reduced availability. The issue affected the authentication (Auth) endpoints, which returned error 429 responses instead of the expected behaviour.

Cause:
The incident was caused by a network configuration change that inadvertently triggered rate limiting on normal API traffic.

Resolution:
The issue has been identified and resolved as of February 13, 09:30 CET. All systems are now fully operational.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

We are currently experiencing a partial performance issue, which may cause employee data being displayed as outdated. Please note that changes are saved correctly in the background. Our engineering teams are already working on a solution.
 
We will keep you posted with the latest information and apologize for any inconvenience this may be caused.

incident_updates.body:
We had an issue with our public API. 

The Public API Gateway service was down, interrupting and causing failures on the API. The endpoints started to send 503 Service Unavailable errors beginning at 7:30 AM. The issue was resolved before usual business hours at 8:30 AM.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

We are aware that some users experience login issues and a presented with a generic error. Our engineering teams are already working on a solution.
 
We will keep you posted with the latest information and apologize for any inconvenience this may be caused.

incidents.name: Processing of updates may be delayed

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

incidents.name: Assigning public holiday calendars not processed

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results. Updates to holiday calendars during the time of the issue might be delayed but are not lost, as we are performing cleanup operations.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

We experience issues when assigning public holiday calendars to offices. The changes are not correctly processed, this may impact customers who change holiday calendars, potentially leading to incorrect absence and attendance balances.
